meanings.definition: Proceed with an action or activity
meanings.sent1: I will carryon with my homework after dinner.
meanings.sent2: She likes to carryon singing even when no one is listening.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to carryon chasing its tail for hours.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to carryon flowing endlessly into the horizon.
meanings.sent5: Despite the rain, the marathon runner was determined to carryon to the finish line.

meanings.definition: Luggage or personal items that can be taken onto a plane
meanings.sent1: Make sure your carryon fits the overhead compartment.
meanings.sent2: She always packs her essentials in her carryon when traveling.
meanings.sent3: The tiny dog peeked out of the carryon bag during the flight.
meanings.sent4: The bright pink carryon stood out among the sea of black suitcases.
meanings.sent5: His carryon contained all his favorite books for the trip.

meanings.definition: Continue without stopping or being interrupted
meanings.sent1: The meeting will carryon until all issues are resolved.
meanings.sent2: Despite the storm, the concert carried on without a hitch.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's tantrum carried on for what felt like hours.
meanings.sent4: The music carried on late into the night at the party.
meanings.sent5: The tradition of storytelling will carryon for generations to come.
